pullRequest.body:
Add some basic lemmas about (univariate) power series over fields and their inverses, aiming at proving that they form a DVR.

Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutos Fernández @mariainesdff

nodes.body: :v: faenuccio can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@riccardobrasca I have done several additions/modifications, you might want to have another round of reviews before I merge. In particular, I am shocked on how [this line](
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/5b6a898cb18280f89e654847dc15adcbb0bf3c3a/Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Inverse.lean#L259) could possibly work (and solve all decidability issues).

> @riccardobrasca I have done several additions/modifications, you might want to have another round of reviews before I merge. In particular, I am shocked on how [this line](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/5b6a898cb18280f89e654847dc15adcbb0bf3c3a/Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Inverse.lean#L259) could possibly work (and solve all decidability issues).

I think this is more or less the same as opening `Classical`. I don't know if it is possible to have a "true" (I mean not given by choice, but by an actual algorithm) decidable equality on power series in certain cases, but if it is that line will probably create diamonds.

> > @riccardobrasca I have done several additions/modifications, you might want to have another round of reviews before I merge. In particular, I am shocked on how [this line](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/5b6a898cb18280f89e654847dc15adcbb0bf3c3a/Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Inverse.lean#L259) could possibly work (and solve all decidability issues).
> 
> I think this is more or less the same as opening `Classical`. I don't know if it is possible to have a "true" (I mean not given by choice, but by an actual algorithm) decidable equality on power series in certain cases, but if it is that line will probably create diamonds.

So what do you suggest me to do? To leave as it is, to open Classical or to manually add [Decidable (f =0)] (and [Decidable (0=0)] on one occasion) all the time?

> > > @riccardobrasca I have done several additions/modifications, you might want to have another round of reviews before I merge. In particular, I am shocked on how [this line](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/5b6a898cb18280f89e654847dc15adcbb0bf3c3a/Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Inverse.lean#L259) could possibly work (and solve all decidability issues).
> > 
> > I think this is more or less the same as opening `Classical`. I don't know if it is possible to have a "true" (I mean not given by choice, but by an actual algorithm) decidable equality on power series in certain cases, but if it is that line will probably create diamonds.
> 
> So what do you suggest me to do? To leave as it is, to open Classical or to manually add [Decidable (f =0)] (and [Decidable (0=0)] on one occasion) all the time?

Thinking more about it, it seems impossible to have an actual algorithm to decide equality, so opening Classical should be fine.  Sorry for the noise.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8725623740/job/23939021569)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8725623740/job/23939021073)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8725623740/job/23939021354)
bors d+

> > > > @riccardobrasca I have done several additions/modifications, you might want to have another round of reviews before I merge. In particular, I am shocked on how [this line](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/5b6a898cb18280f89e654847dc15adcbb0bf3c3a/Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Inverse.lean#L259) could possibly work (and solve all decidability issues).
> > 
> > I think this is more or less the same as opening `Classical`. I don't know if it is possible to have a "true" (I mean not given by choice, but by an actual algorithm) decidable equality on power series in certain cases, but if it is that line will probably create diamonds.
> 
> So what do you suggest me to do? To leave as it is, to open Classical or to manually add [Decidable (f =0)] (and [Decidable (0=0)] on one occasion) all the time?

> Thinking more about it, it seems impossible to have an actual algorithm to decide equality, so opening Classical should be fine.  Sorry for the noise. 

Done! And thanks for all your comments.

```suggestion
theorem not_isField : ¬IsField A⟦X⟧ := by
```
I didn't test if `nontriviality` does its job, but the assumption is useless.
Corrected

```suggestion
theorem X_irreducible : Irreducible (X : R⟦X⟧) := X_prime.irreducible
```
not 100% sure, but `X_prime` is with lowercase `p`.
BTW, do we have those for polynomials?
Yes we do, in Polynomial.irreducible_X (which has lowercase "i" so I changed it).

```suggestion
def firstUnitCoeff {f : k⟦X⟧} (hf : f ≠ 0) : kˣ :=
  let d := f.order.get (order_finite_iff_ne_zero.mpr hf)
  have f_const : coeff k d f ≠ 0 := by apply coeff_order
  have : Invertible (constantCoeff k (divided_by_X_pow_order hf)) := by
    apply invertibleOfNonzero
    convert f_const using 1
    rw [← coeff_zero_eq_constantCoeff, ← zero_add d]
    convert (coeff_X_pow_mul (exists_eq_mul_right_of_dvd (X_pow_order_dvd
      (order_finite_iff_ne_zero.mpr hf))).choose d 0).symm
    exact (self_eq_X_pow_order_mul_divided_by_X_pow_order hf).symm
  unitOfInvertible (constantCoeff k (divided_by_X_pow_order hf))
```
untested
It worked!

```suggestion
```
Instead of this you can use `[Decidable (f = 0)]` in the definitions, and start the proofs by `Classical`.
Done
Can this be `simp` or the linter complains?
Nope, that's fine (and added)
Is this really needed?
Probably not, removed
Can you add the double implication? (As a lemma, we still want this instance).
Sure, I will add this and then merge. Thanks.
Since the full name is `PowerSeries.subsingleton_iff` I think you should switch the two implications.
Done
Isn't this found automatically?
Yes, removed (it was not the case in Lean3)

```suggestion
/-- The maximal ideal of `k⟦X⟧` is generated by `X`. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (RingTheory/PowerSeries): Add basic lemmas aiming at proving that power series over a field are a DVR
